713497f-a.text:
234 to 240 West 50th Street, south side, slightly east of Eighth Ave., showing the area being used as an automobile parking space, after the demolition of three 3-story buildings.  On the left appears the rear of St. Malachy's (R.C.) Church, No. 241-245 West 49th Street, north side, between Eighth Ave. and Broadway.  This view was taken from the Capitol Theatre, at the S.W. corner of Broadway and West 51st Street.

October 24, 1928
F.L. Sperr.

The site was occupied by two old type framed dwellings, the last in this area, and a 3-story brick bldg occupied by Kliegel Bros.

Greyhound Bus Terminal built c. 1935, demolished c. 1962. Site now vacant again! (1965)
